content: Is there any existing sample(s) for such a statement? Thanks.

Noting that every FHIR Server MUST support the /metadata endpoint. Note also the TerminologyCapabilities with the mode=terminology parameter - http://tx.fhir.org/r4/metadata?_format=json&mode=terminology

Yes, @Lin Zhang, the link that you posted is the one that the spec provides. It is a perfectly valid example, but we also should be clear that it is a "Basic capability statement for a Terminology Server" and that "this is the minimum amount". We expect that most (or most likely all) "real" terminology servers will have significantly more than this.
Agree. Even the full set of FHIR Terminology Services is only a kind-of subset of the CTS2 functionality.
Now I think we need to provide a step-by-step/101 guide for setting up a FHIR terminilogy server based on an existing FHIR server such as HAPI FHIR JPA Server.
HAPI jpaserver-starter is what I'm using for mine.
Indeed, it's a pretty good start. More terminology-server specific guidance would be more desirable.

Hello Everyone,

I am trying to set up FHIR terminology Server using HAPI starter project. How do i chnage the Capability statement to make it support as terminology server only and not complete FHIR server.
